summary: Build a romantic, mobile-responsive single-page webpage for "Pondati" with a Valentine prompt, playful dodging "No" button, and a birthday message reveal on "Yes" click (optimized for Android Chrome).
architectural_notes: Single-page, mobile-first responsive layout targeted for Android Chrome
Use JavaScript to reposition the "No" button randomly on hover/click and keep "Yes" stationary
On "Yes" click, replace/transition main content to a reveal section/message
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Romantic collage-style background with warm pink/red tones and soft bokeh hearts (valentine-collage-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Seamless subtle heart pattern texture, warm pink on cream (heart-pattern-tile.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-first, single-page romantic UI that displays the headline text exactly: "Pondati, will you be my Valentine?" and shows two clearly labeled buttons: "Yes" and "No".

Implement a playful interaction for the "No" button: when the user attempts to interact with it (hover on desktop, pointer-down/tap on mobile), the button should move to a new random position within the visible safe area so it becomes difficult or impossible to click.

When the user clicks "Yes", replace the main page content with a romantic reveal view and display the message text exactly as follows (with reasonable line breaks/paragraph styling): "Happy Birthday Pondati! I know you’re thinking that I forgot your birthday, but I didn’t. Thank you for everything. Thank you for loving me. Thank you for all the moments we have spent together. Be happy, stay healthy. Happy Birthday Pondati, my sweet potato!"

Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme (not blue/purple) across the page: soft warm palette (pinks/reds/creams), elegant typography (including a cursive-style headline), subtle animations (e.g., floating hearts or gentle fade/scale transitions), and consistent spacing and alignment.
Add the required generated images as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and use them in the UI (e.g., as background/texture) without routing images through the backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a romantic, mobile-responsive single-page webpage that asks: "Pondati, will you be my Valentine?" with Yes/No buttons
Add playful interaction: the "No" button moves/becomes unclickable when hovered or clicked so it cannot be selected
On "Yes" click, replace the page content with a romantic themed reveal message wishing "Happy Birthday Pondati" and the provided text
Ensure responsive design and compatibility for opening on Android using Chrome (mobile-first layout, clean CSS/JS)

projectName: Romantic single-page Valentine prompt with playful dodging No button and Birthday reveal
